content.content: Values  Cautious optimism Long-term scalability Adaptability  Delegate Address:  0x92e1ca8b69a44bb17afa92838da68fc41f12250a etherscan Forum: @twblack88 Email (optional): [email protected] External Website: twitter  Why delegate to me? In my humble opinion, being a delegate is simply about responsibility and leveraging aligned incentives.  Who am I? I’ve been around the block in crypto at both centralized and decentralized companies/communities. I did some stuff and such for community development at the Foundation.  Delegation as Responsibility Applying as a delegate is a forcing function for me: become a better member of the community. In addition, delegation feeds into the two projects I’m still working on, the revised and relaunched Maker badges and Maker Relay. We have plans to scale Maker Relay into something far more robust eventually. What form it takes is still up for exploring and questions. The Relay makes me a more informed voter, which is great. It’s also an exciting thing to provide, working together for our numerous stakeholders. Completely revised Badges, of course, need no introduction but needless to say, they will be exciting.  Values Cautious optimism - I’ve been reading about mindsets a lot recently and operate from this position: “pessimism is easy, whereas optimism is hard.” MakerDAO has already exercised extraordinary caution and restraint in a historical frothy space. I’d vote to stay aligned with the mindset that brought us innovations like liquidations 2.0. Steady testing, reliable math, and thoughtful intention. When it works, then celebrate the process that got us there but still, always aware that there are looming threats to the protocol we need to be conscious of. Long term scalability The only thing that matters is that DAI is bulletproof for the long term. I see USDC as a current hairy problem that we’ll find an elegant solution to. Then there will be another problem for us to handle. I think with each of these challenges we grow stronger as a community. Stealing a metaphor from Matt Rabinowitz here: I intend to vote for rates parameters and technical decisions that enable walking first and then running. Then, I dunno, like speedboating or something. Adaptability Conversely, if you blend my optimism and startup experience into a bit of a paradox, I do think there are nimble opportunities that pop up from time to time that are worth pursuing. I think staying adaptable to layups is key for the team.  Aligned incentives > conflict of interest Interestingly, I don’t have any conflicts of interest; I align incentives instead. . I always try to keep any full-time employment: focused, relevant, and adjacent to Maker. This focuses my full attention on participating here while leveraging collaborative opportunities.  Possible conflict of interest? Payment It’s worth stating that as a delegate, I won’t be doing this all for free. I don’t think it’s fair to expect a 10 hour minimum of weekly work to be an informed voter on behalf of others without some level of compensation. We haven’t figured out the model for this quite yet, once we have the rough edges I will communicate what I think is the best approach. Keeper? Not sure if operating a keeper is a conflict of interest, but I do have some hope in getting the backstop keeper running on a computer at home. I will probably get sandwiched, but hey, one for the cause, am I right? I read and agree to follow the Delegate Code of Conduct. I’ll leave the bit about payments and keepers since that’s more forum-appropriate. But I removed that blurb from the delegate profile since it seemed like clutter.  edit Q1 2022 Thanks to @flipflopflapdelegate will refer to FeeblackLoops as FBL for short.  Added an email from our custom domain. Cleaned up conflict of interest paragraph a bit. Changelog here  edit July 2022  added new delegate contract & profile links here on the forum and in github markdown.   edit Dec 2023  Added a fancy new disclaimer, if you’re an MKR holder and want to be litigious; we’ve got you covered.

content.content: Some of these opinions are gonna be annoying, we can have that conversation back in the original threads, but I apologize for lurking and not commenting lately. Sometimes less is more. Parameter Changes Proposal - MakerDAO Open Market Committee - October 18, 2021 Yes - The market is definitely moving quickly and the OMC articulated sensible parameters to meet demand. Again. Ratification Poll for Adding the Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit (DECO-001) - October 11, 2021 Abstain - I’ve done what I can to keep up with this unit and all the fixed rate pros/cons abstaining is the best option. All I want to see is that the comp aligns with long-term interests, which AES articulated summarized here:    MIP39c2-SP23: Adding the Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit   A better approach, which still aligns the incentives of new revenue stream CUs with that of MKR holders is to have additional MKR tokens unlock upon achievement of specific revenue milestones. Doing so provides fully aligned incentives where CU and MKR holders win together. In the current proposal, it is quite easy to envision multiple scenarios where Deco wins and MKR holders lose.   Ratification Poll for Adding Data Insights Core Unit (DIN-001) - October 11, 2021 Yes - We need more data to understand Maker’s performance on a variety of benchmarks. Plus, proposal revisions with other delegates sets a good example. Ratification Poll for Growth Core Unit Budget, GRO-001 (MIP40c3-SP37) - October 11, 2021 Yes - Continues to be one of the most transparent teams that continually delivers value for the community. Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget, MKT-001 (MIP40c3-SP33) - October 11, 2021 Yes - but looking forward to clearer budgets in the future. Ratification Poll for Adding MakerLabs Core Unit (SNUNK-001) - October 11, 2021 Abstain - These cats are some of my favorite people abstained to not block things. Yet, EurDAI is way too big for an ‘MVP’ approach. There are other low-hanging fruits to jam on with the community and get out the door. If it ends up failing I’m stoked to see revisions, if passes, hey that’s dope too. Ratification Poll for Implementation of DSS Charter (MIP59) - October 11, 2021 Yes - Institutional access to Maker is, sadly, one of the key levers to growing supply. Once Nexo clarified how their positions would benefit the ecosystem writ large via their desk, they convinced me.

content.content: Feedblack loops polling votes are up. Parameter Changes Proposal - MakerDAO Open Market Committee - November 1, 2021 - Yes, because Sensible parameter changes all around. Highlights include changing ETH-B to be more cautious (as noted in this week’s relay that risk premium is pretty high) and getting some fees out of the old USDC-A vault. Lower PSM Vault Fees - November 1, 2021 Yes. What matters more is that DAI is exchangeable one to one across as many venues of liquidity as possible, more than any fees we might generate or any vault friction it may produce. If we see that any single stablecoin starts to comprise an uncomfortable amount of DAI generated, well then ….back the fees go. In addition, we’ll have to be more creative around managing different fees on different PSMs. @PaperImperium s already polling for a stepwise reduction towards zero which I’m uncertain is the best approach, but open to seeing how it goes. I am curious if this will fill up that quickly or the average PSM vault size. Community Greenlight Poll - MDI (MD Irradiance LLC) - November 1, 2021 - abstain. “6s for late-stage solar” sounds straightforward but losing a RWA committee member with expertise is a hefty price. More thoughts on the ohm-ies are coming, after evaluating the risk to Maker a little more (having some conversations to steer research).

content.content: 11-10 Feedblack loops votes Recognised Delegate Compensation Increase - November 8, 2021 Yes - No surprise here, delegation is starting to encroach on my time personally and has burdened others quite a bit more. In order to onboard more delegates, this LLC recommends compensating them well. More long-term, happy to work with as many teams as possible to improve the delegation framework. We think we’ve learned a lot in these past few months about how to make this process improve. NS-DROP Covenant Modification - November 8, 2021 Abstain - There’s too much in flux with real world finance to adjust any covenants parameters or take on additional risk. Feedblack loops recommends getting the RWA & RWF houses into a more clear direction before revisions. That being said we think this is a blip and look forward to better-structured deals for RWA in general. GUNIV3DAIUSDC-A Parameter Adjustments - November 8, 2021 Yes - Already this vault has performed tremendously, every Relay we write on the rundown and it’s shocking to see the hockey stick. Happy to endorse the vault’s ceiling and parameter adjustments. Increase the WSTETH-A Debt Ceiling - November 8, 2021 Yes- The experiment here succeeded, following the SR from PE’s recommendations it seems like a logical next step to increase wstETH. DIRECT-AAVEV2-DAI Parameter Adjustments - November 8, 2021 Yes- It’s essential that we keep building on the PE work by growing D3  exposure slowly “to 20% of the Aave v2 DAI supply market.” as per risk eval. Add WBTC-B as a new Vault Type - November 8, 2021 Yes- The WBTC market is only growing + Maker has a pretty close split with Aave and compound for WBTC share. Based on the velocity of new whales entering DeFi, it’s good to have a choice for users looking to suck the marrow out of ….whatever the heck you call this market RN Ratification Poll for Supplement to Collateral Onboarding Application (MIP6c3-SP1) - November 8, 2021 Yes- making MIP 6 more articulate for new RWA will help us catch inconsistencies earlier. Even though these are quite verbose to begin with IMHO. Ratification Poll for the Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001) - November 8, 2021 Yes - An incentivized bug bounty program actively run? Yes please, we need more of that. Ratification Poll for Adding the Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit (DECO-001) - November 8, 2021 Yes - Deco unleashes far more potential than the concerns raised. To name a few positives: they unblock PE, help growth with a novel product, all access and controls are managed by maker governance, and open new markets for Maker. Sorry to be controversial. The other core units and OHM are still in review.

content.content: Thanksgiving Polls. Grateful for the Maker Community. Add WBTC-C as a new Vault Type - November 22, 2021 Yes- As always, we’re curious to see what happens when we tweak parameters and how vaults migrate. Hopefully, this helps us protect Maker in the event of a severe market unwind. If ETH and WBTC are the fastest-growing collaterals in DeFi it makes sense to acknowledge growing demand and give users an opportunity to engage with Maker Vaults while protecting downside risk. Increase the System Surplus Buffer - November 22, 2021 Yes and voted for: Increase to 90 million by 1 million per week. After re-reading the threads and checking the arguments for a linear increase it made more sense to focus on rounder numbers. We still maintain that a revised surplus buffer mechanism is the best approach for Maker long term, and with a couple of changes/ideas on the forums the solution for the community is around the corner. hopefully, someday, we inch towards something Iike this:    [Signal Request] Increasing the Surplus Buffer (2021-11)   like “use 25% of burning and put 75% into the System Surplus”.   Add a GUSD Peg Stability Module - November 22, 2021 Yes- Though we have half the float for USDP, another PSM is just a signal of confidence. Gemini has been around forever, proven themselves to be reliable and high integrity. Its reminiscent of adding WBTC the first time, where Maker is the use case to prove out the infrastructure. Increase the Aave D3M Maximum Debt Ceiling - November 22, 2021 Yes- Huge congrats to getting this module delivered, the first DC seems to have functioned quite well. We’re still not at the level that risk outlined we could reach with this module to keep the rates in the target. Cautiously optimistic to see this model expand to other lending markets over time and survive some market wobbles.

content.content: Stealing from Monet here to order based on for, against and abstain. Also, I’m putting reasoning up before voting. Trying to be proactive putting explanations before voting.  Yes   Ratification Poll for the Strategic Finance Core Unit (SF-001) Yes - This team is a huge value add for the community and through the 14 revisions of their MIP the roadmap has become clear. It’s also a great use of Seb’s talents, working on higher-level finance was something we suggested on a community call a year ago. Nice to see it happen. Can’t wait for the first strategic focus call. Ratification Poll for Collateral Offboarding Process (MIP62) Yes- @GFXlabs did great here outlining a much-improved process to refer to, link out, and communicate across the community when collaterals are getting removed. Ratification Poll for Core Unit Budget, SNE-001 (MIP40c3-SP47)  Yes - The DAO-to-DAO splitting of cost here is the best part of this core unit. Layer 2’s are the future and the wormhole needs Starknet. Ratification Poll for Bug Bounty Program for MakerDAO Critical Infrastructure (MIP64)  Yes - Now that immunifi is here, it’s time to flex some muscle on the bug bounties and protect our users. One highlight here is the robustness of in-scope & out-of-scope parts of the proposal. Ratification Poll for Maker Keeper Network (MIP63) Yes - Plus one to keeper improvements, saving everyone gas by having an option to work together in a unified way that’s still permission-less is clutch. Ratification Poll for Facilitator Onboarding for RWF-001 (MIP41c4-SP27) Yes - The business continuity here was not the best, but glad we have the opportunity to onboard Will onto this team. HIs expertise is needed. Ratification Poll for Development & UX Core Unit Budget - DUX-001 (MIP40c3-SP52) Yes - The value this team provides for the expense is in multiples. Exciting to see the changes in personnel coming down the pipe so there is more momentum on voting experiments. Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget - Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling (SES-001) (MIP40c3-SP55)  Yes - No surprises here that keeping SES funded and healthy is helping the DAO writ large. Community Greenlight Poll - TUSD-PSM (TrueUSD)  Yes (Greenlight ) - FLLLC is Generally in favor of PSM diversity. There was a time where TUSD was celebrating 100 million as a milestone, it’s nice to see that it’s grown enough to do millions in volume. Prioritize Onboarding a Compound DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M)  Yes - This module has proven itself well on Aave to it’s only logical to extend to compound to stabilize the rates in DeFi a bit more. Prioritize DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) for Maple Finance Yes - Controversial, but this gives us a chance to put D3M in the hands of more protocols, control it if things seem to go south, and work with a team that executes with institutional clients. A win/win/win to quote Michael Scott. There are concerns though about who gets hit first in a shortfall, so hopefully before we crank this up these are addressed. Increase the Dust Parameter for Select LP Token Vaults - January 10, 2022 Yes- Analysis here was thorough and clear, thanks for the reading @monet-supply! Wish we had this split up so the forums votes FLLLC posted would match, but for the sake of Governance overhead, it’s fine. **Proposal - Recover DAI Locked in Optimism Escrow  Yes - We’ve had many debates about helping users in the past, this thread is doing a good job of discussing some general best practices. Utilizing a signed transaction seems like a happy medium. In addition, because we’re just recovering funds instead of something else this is a positive for the community.  Abstain   **Raise the Emergency Shutdown Module (ESM) Threshold  Abstain - If we are worried about single actors this mitigates that, so… sure. There is a greater concern about rallying enough support to trigger ESM if we actually need it, and there isn’t enough time to track down where all the MKR sits or if the community has a deep enough relationship with that holder. Somewhat recalling drunk whale moments from this. Hoping for the best if it passes though, cautious optimism. **Community Greenlight Poll - OGN (Origin Protocol)  & **Community Greenlight Poll - OUSD (Origin Dollar)  Abstain- Conflict of interest here preventing objective voting on both collaterals. That being said it’s encouraging to see the team’s commitment to helping make the collateral type profitable and commitment to growing the market for OUSD. Slightly worried that some of OUSD are backed by DAI, but I think an evaluation about leverage, via risk, would illuminate that concern more with data. Community Greenlight Poll - RBLD (Robinland Holdings)  Abstain - Not enough information to have an opinion one way or another. Just haven’t had the time to review this application in depth. Good thing there is time to revisit. **Ratification Poll for Offboarding Content Production Core Unit (MKT-001)  Abstain- FLLLC is keeping conflict of interests low again, which seems to be the theme of this polling cycle. Since I personally work cross-functionally with this team in an individual contributor capacity every week it seems only right to abstain. That being said I commented on that thread about how content has been handicapped by our community and should push come to shove this vote will go no. **Ratification Poll for Onboarding Tech-Ops Core Unit (TECH-001)  Abstain - I’ve personally worked with this team through the foundation and watching them mature / convert to a core unit is going to be great for the community. Keeping conflict of interest low here, unless the votes are needed to verify the team.  No   **Community Greenlight Poll - USDap (BondAppetit) No (Defer) - Too small to be profitable and extra RWA asset risk that hasn’t been qualified.

twblack88:  That being said I commented on that thread about how content has been handicapped by our community and should push come to shove this vote will go no.    Changing off-boarding vote Something has felt off, been wrestling with this decision & outcomes all weekend. Every time we opened the voting portal to vote on the exec and play gas-wars, that polling vote for MKT-001 screams out as a poor precedent to set. So, F3LC is flipping from ‘abstaining’ to ‘no.’ Why? This off-boarding has highlighted a gap in Core Unit governance and exploited it. A lack of subjective process, with a clear gap in what comes next, sticks out as most problematic. The additional work and stress on gov-alpha, gov-comms, and the tech ops teams waste time and effort. Regardless of the outcome, standing up for doing better DAO-wide is worth the gas.  Accountability DAO-Wide We all need to do better on accountability. It should be the standard, not a vague call where no one takes responsibility. The DAO needs to be more scrutinous upfront of CU’s, and CU’s need to push for excellence & transparency. I think @juan said it best on a GnR call “do good, consistent work, and show up, don’t over-ask.” So, on that note, will be pushing for accountability in these ways:  Working with a few other cross-functional folks to revise our off-boarding MIPs so this is clearer for everyone. (MIP inbound thanks to @paperimperium ) Hopefully, assisting @Aes and their team to make sure KPIs and better reporting become obvious, summarized, and clear across the community. Also, I’ve personally been trying to offer perspective to the team on the public chopping block. This whole situation could be an opportunity to rise to the occasion (for what it’s worth, I think all the responses in RFC did highlight room for improvement, though mostly vague). This as an opportunity to grow, set S.M.A.R.T. KPIs, and as @MadShills noted here in a months time:     MIP41c5-SP3: Facilitator Offboarding (MKT-001)    By Feb 2022, content production either has the capabilities to produce a strategy and clear KPIs, or not. If they are able to produce the KPIs and strategy, they can make their case for funding to execute on them in Q2 2022. If not, they were well paid the entire time for their work, no hard feelings and everyone has been treated fairly with no surprises. If content production is funded through Q2 2022, prior to the approval of a Q3 2022 budget there would be appropriate measures to evaluate performance, which remedies the current unfortunate situation.    Or not, we’ll see how the vote goes and move on from there. Together. Onwards and upwards Maker community. LFG

content.content: twblack88:  PE   What is PE?
Protocol engineering core unit. (PECU)

Supported the out of band executive Mitigate Post-Shutdown Flash Loan Vulnerability - March 9, 2022 this morning  YES Offboarding TUSD parameters. Continuing the process for offboarding TUSD.  Abstain Reinstate surplus buffer LERP Tl; Dr Currently, in a paradox opinion-state, it’s better to abstain. It is possible to be both simultaneously in favor of a larger buffer to fuel growth and somewhat displeased we’re making what, superficially, seems like reactive decisions. It’s fine going with governance in this case whichever way it lands.  Longer opinion on the burn and some next steps It’s been three weeks since the last post on bringing back the burn. Sure feels like a lifetime. After looking at numerous inputs it’s clear that we should be adaptable; from supply flattening out into a choppy market (at best), centralization of borrowers, this report of the actual expenses, and a pipeline of available teams; our costs are increasing but profits aren’t scaling to match. With the limiter in place, we can deal with existential protocol threats but a looming crash would still put the entirety of the DAO at risk. The 3% target recommended by risk is ~90MM, but is that really enough? An attempt at profits when the market is whipsawing isn’t going to end well. Even for more medium term bulls on MKR. Overall, strategically evaluating the buffer & burn is a desperate need. F3LC is very in favor of a new system managing P&L writ large. On that topic, we remain cautiously optimistic since there are numerous ideas that will hopefully coalesce soon  . Speaking of momentum, working on a research SPF about the burn’s performance and providing modeling for the DAO. The idea is: paying researchers from a neutral third party would set us up for objective evaluations of this mechanic. So we can, once and for all, stop cycling and strategically move forward; it feels like we’re playing the same song over and over again.  If you’re interested in contributing to the draft, DM me!

The quality of these folks is unmistakable, and frankly, as someone who has booked events, set their budgets, worked them as an AV tech, etc., this SPF is a pretty decent cost/benefit. Initial Parameters for StarkNet Simple DAI Bridge - March 28, 2022  Yes - Low limit bridge to a cutting edge Rollup. Ship it. Short Ratification Poll for MIP62 Amendments (MIP4c3-SP2) - March 28, 2022  Yes - More Offboarding complications, sigh. New-ish process soon   Check the thread for more updates there. @blimpa & @gala have been expert collaborators. Investigate Implementation of a Notional Finance D3M - March 28, 2022  Abstain First reasoning of, “add it to the backlog, sure? I guess?” Hasn’t changed. So…. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ FWIW sounds like abstain. The actual decision point for Notional is risk calculus, comparing it to compound D3M out in the wild. Best for risk to sound off than handwave; we lack the staff at F3LC to handle that much modeling. The entire thread was an excellent sounding call towards reducing some friction points:  More clarity all around; on signaling, in COB, in D3M specifics, in prioritization … Teams should bring deals to Maker, ideally with significant upside. Delegates can help sure, even source opportunities but the team should probably own the MIP or signal(s). Even if meaning well and abstaining, having delegates steer the short-term roadmap seems like a complex headache for everyone. Unless a core unit’s bandwidth is constrained and we can be helpful! As a community, we try to assume good faith, and it looks like we somewhat forgot. Be like bob ross

content.content: ** FEI Vote change** Some of my delegators urged me to take a second glance at the reasoning around FEI. Stakeholder engagement out of usually scheduled check-ins is rare, so we appreciate the nudge to reevaluate the decision. At first glance, and on our first vote reasoning, the FEI vault is low technical lift and brings revenues, which are good. The team reached out, and I asked them to come to the forums instead. They did, which is good. The first thing is: that once collateral gets greenlit, there is little chance to say no, other than one recommendation to keep the debt ceiling low. “It’s only a green light” is incomplete reasoning on my part. Once the foot is in, the pressure is on the CU’s to make deals happen. Which we have to fix as a community. Teams need to be able to say no, both faster and sooner. The second thing is research: after digging a little deeper into some debates on discord, listening to stakeholders, and too much reading (on the weekend, no less), this vault allows FEI to grow with a discount line of credit where we take on multiple risks. 2.5 on 100 Mil doesn’t seem like the fairest shake. There has to be a better deal putting Maker first and having a fair cost to FEI. We are both stablecoins, after all. With all the code coming out of that team and the competence of its DAO leaders, I’m sure there are some creative win/wins. It seems like the energy exists across multiple teams to make a deal. Let’s do that. FEI should utilize Maker, Maker should help teams expand when deals are win/win, but they might as well use their collateral that backs FEI, which is ETH, which we have vaults for. Other teams that build do this already. Or ship the draft code for 4626 as Ilk types. Or negotiate for an institutional vault down the line and a couple of milestones to get there. Plenty of options, it seems.

content.content: We are giving this its own post. Deploy a Trial Permissionless Open Market Operation - June 13, 2022 (thread) Voted: No then Yes Reasoning: :cracks-knuckles We have been thinking through this burn vote so much that we didn’t even post the vote and comment on the OG thread due to waffling. Sigh. On the one hand, the most valuable thing about the burn is sending a commitment to our community of MKR holders. Three reasons why:  if we’re going to start moving into a new paradigm of more involved governance and more involved MKR holders, showing them that we still care about the value of MKR, both intangible and intrinsic, is probably essential. deploying Dss kiln in the wild it’s going to be a handy tool, and we’re going to need it. MKR is cheap now, which is good timing.  Then there is the other side,  common sense:  burning is a bad look optically. As a regular vault holder who might have gotten liquidated, that sends a message that’s… not great. second, we’ve been dishonest with ourselves that the burn doesn’t function as we want it to.  Then there’s the ancillary reasoning too, which is that loosely spending money just because we’re lucky to have funds on something that the DAO isn’t aligned around, is chaotic and kind of foolish. Reasoning like, “oh, we have this extra money from liquidations. We might as well spend it on this burn experiment.” That’s…flawed logic. Taking the pros/cons into account is plus 3 “for the burn” plus 2 for “not burn,” and the wild card is that we’re making a poorly reasoned decision due to liquidations makes it an experiment that’s covered (  no idea how to score that). Based on those reasons, FBL values of community, and embracing this paradox, we should do this with a caveat. ** Immediately after this vote,  writing begins a MIPS 13 For declaration of intent.  Here are the broad strokes: “Should the burn underperform on its 3-month target (measured as an expected price increase of some percent from burn date), The DAO will not take any action on burning for over a year.” Just a one-year DOI, simple & straightforward. If anybody wants to collaborate on this MIP, more than welcome. It seems like every month, the burn comes up, wastes energy and time, and distracts necessary community bandwidth & resources that need an allocation to worthier endeavors. The mechanic is primitive, and there is a screaming pile of data that MKR trades on Macro. Full stop. It’s an ERC-20 token; we’re not special. Yet. Here’s to seeing that thesis proved wrong in the wild, instead of debating endlessly from uninformed market data and reading tea leaves.

Approve without delegated authority to spend funds Reasoning: We don’t share the community rancor, but trying to grow Maker is why we’re all here. This MIP: lacked broad enough consensus and jumped into governance cycle a bit early with a big ask. A couple AMA’s, some more inclusive meetings, a few pitch decks, and some clarity might be the way but at the moment this needs a focus on what exactly the DAO gets with the spend. Ratification Poll for Adding Lending Oversight Core Unit (LOVE-001) - June 13, 2022 Voted: No Reasoning: Luca is a fantastic contributor, highly experienced, and a value add for the DAO. His assessments have always been helpful, and we’re lucky to have him here. But as is, this CU lacks concrete deliverables beyond the first three months, and since RWF hasn’t shipped it’s larger deals, this CU seems premature. Should we be working with Luca? Yes, we’re absolutely blessed to have his focus! Extra reviewing eyes will 100% be necessary, but in the next few months, no probably not. This seems like a team we need in a year, not right now. We can’t justify another million-dollar spend without clear goals or timelines. For full transparency, should this vote fail and this team tighten up to apply again, FBL is happy to evaluate out of the formalized MIP40 budget windows. Makershire Poll JUN 13 2022 Voted: Yes Reasoning: Like Makerman, FBL has long supported a more active balance sheet management and gaining return on idle assets. There are a few worrying parts to this proposal, but it’s structured in a way that the downside for SF is far higher than the returns to the DAO. It’s thankless work to help us stay afloat without burning the house down. We need a team focused on increasing liquidity and taking advantage of simple yield. LFS  Supported executive MKR Vesting Transfers - June 22, 2022 reasoning: We can’t renege on Core Unit agreements as they reach vesting. Supported executive Core Unit Distributions, Delegate Comp, Keeper Streams  Reasoning: Voting for Getting CUs paid

content.content: Ratification Poll for Endgame Prelaunch MIP Set - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning:  Ahhh Endgame  After months of Endgame DVC’s, individual consultations with facilitators, office hours attendance, and lots of reading on Endgame, we are pretty sure the status quo only has about 10% likelihood to last more than a few years. Whereas working towards Endgame, Maker’s longevity chances increase to 30%. With our research, we concur with LFW and a16z that the ideal path is a phased rollout with a focused working group. Plenty of operational changes would help; counterintuitively those improvements & implementations are on everyone who wants to contribute. As the voting officer at FBL, a vote for Endgame for me personally is recognition. I am 90% sure that our current CU model will not succeed. The incentives from the get-go were poorly designed, primarily by happenstance. Yet! There is still so much talent, so much skill, and so much experience inside of makerDAO’s current workforce that restructuring can deliver positive results. A radical one may not be entirely necessary, and realistically, it’s a year of work and focus (maybe two). There can be an extended discussion about how most of the issues today stem from the foundation, both haplessly and practically, ill equipping this community with adequate tooling. Yet, we have delivered experiments in the real world; we have a handful of incredible partners competing for idle assets; we have retained the best risk team in the business. Protocol engineering is incredible, and their dedication continues even though they should have long since quit when the community took a negative turn. Govalpha shows up to do hybrid work on the cutting edge of innovation and rage. We could keep going 19 more times, but to all the CUs making this framework function, it is incredible how well it has functioned. The loyalty here is unimaginable, especially for a crypto protocol, an industry where talent comes and goes weekly. An additional thanks to the attendees of my RFC calls for their openness and for sharing their unique perspectives. A glimpse into the lives of the people who work this protocol daily and the facilitators who manage them brought clarity to this vote… Endgame will iterate dozens of times, so we at FBL are here to roll up our sleeves and get s*** done. This vote is a commitment to the people who are here. And it is a matching of skills, eloquence, elegance, and excellence. Let us be excellent: excellent to each other and excellent to our legacy of work.

content.content: Hmmm left these as a draft? oy vey. Apologies. Ratification Poll for Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001) Facilitator Onboarding (MIP41c4-SP38) - November 14, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: Originally, abstained on this first version of this poll. Now that a little more data is in the open it seems like a second facilitator isn’t necessary. Ratification Poll for CoinShares Active Treasury Management (MIP86) - November 14, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: Since governance has voted on excess USDC then available, going to just say no to proposals of this type moving forward until the house gets in order.  Coinshares had many incongruencies up front but did a decent job of articulating confusing portions of their proposal. Optimistic for a revision / different approach. Ratification Poll for OUSD Decentralized Rewards (MIP87) - November 14, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: Origin team has shown lots of resilience but this MIP got rushed into a vote before answering existential risks. In addition it has the same problem: asking for excess USDC then available. Ratification Poll for Modify Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001) Mandate (MIP39c2-SP38) - November 14, 2022 (thread) Voted: Abstain Reasoning: Can’t really decide, abstain. On the one hand, not sure if we need this unit at the moment. Reading through past reports and updates, a majority of the time seems like negotiating with whitehats about bug escalation/categorization (though the one critical bug blog post was a nice read). Instead of finding attack surfaces and trying to source the biggest threats, ISCU been caught on programs that are more obligations than leverage for the DAO. On the other hand, you definitely want a bug program focusing on the right outcomes and incentivizing white hats. If this doesn’t pass there is probably an opportunity to consolidate and reallocate focus/learnings towards whitehat incentives. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Immunefi Security (IS-001) Budget (MIP40c3-SP83) - November 14, 2022 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve reduced budget - BearMarket 2nd choice: Reject budget Reasoning: Though we can’t support the updated mandate without revisions, a bear market push to allocate resources towards stronger impact is a worthy approach, voting reduce or reject. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Governance Communications Core Unit DAI Budget, COM-001 (MIP40c3-SP84) - November 14, 2022 (thread) Voted: Abstain Reasoning: We’ve abstained on most gov-comms votes to date, will continue that pattern. If this vote continues it’s momentum, quite confident this team can slot into another CU or re-org and start showing the community how external actors set an example. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify TechOps Core Unit DAI Budget, TECH-001 (MIP40c3-SP86) - November 14, 2022 (thread) Voted: Reject Budget Reasoning: Generally find tech-ops both open and helpful. That being said, nothing personal but worth flagging: there are a few pieces of this budget that need transparency/revision; we don’t have a veto option so, voting no. “Recruiting” is vague (are those hiring bonuses or actual people? ), travel is basically 7 conferences a year for everyone (?), and there isn’t a bear base on the budget, so it’s not following the new MIP40 standard etc. Ratification Poll for Modify Emulated Surplus Buffer Upper Limit (MIP84c10-SP1) - November 14, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: The thing isn’t spec-ed, implemented, or deployed but we’re tuning the parameters? Definitely understand the urgency and statement behind the MIP but even if this did pass, there would just be another one to change the parameters in the future.  DAI Savings Rate Adjustment - November 28, 2022 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Leave the DSR unchanged at 0.01% Reasoning: General shout out to everyone on the thread for being clear and not going off the rails this time. The discussion around raising the rate has been a good example of how Governance approached ideas in the past.  That being said it seems like more fine-tuning and understanding the use case for this is warranted. Voting to keep it the same for now, but open to debating the full route for users and protocols in the future. There is a time to deploy the DSR, it seems like that time isn’t now. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - November 28, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Onboard with these changes, well reasoned. Opening up to more stETH and fine tuning the tins on other PSMs is good to see, plus a call to safety on compound D3M. Undertake Necessary Risk and Legal Assessments to Increase the NS-DROP Debt Ceiling to 50 Million DAI - November 28, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning:  Have we ever said no to voluntarily increasing fees?

content.content: Not supporting but securing; moved MKR to support the last exec of the year. As big as this spell was, which is a coordination achievement, there are things in there that are not in line with FBL polling votes and we need to start unbundling in the new year. Likely in a few months, minor issues will sort out but these come to mind:  DSR without a robust plan or rigorous user research/modelling (putting governance on the hook for the inevitable USDC that ends up in the PSM as a result). RWA terms are 60 months, that’s the majority of the age of makerdao in general.  Balancing minor objections against ushering GNO and the risk of renBTC was challenging which is primarily why we delayed. Not looking for drama or a fight, glad to see delegates push it across the line. content.content: Ratification Poll for Pioneer DeFi-focused Language Dataset for the Benefit of Risk Modelling & Governance Communication (MIP55c3-SP11) - December 12, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: To be clear, no problem investing resources into something that seems novel and interesting. Anything that broadens Maker’s risk management ability for our users and for the protocol is, in general, worth pursuing. But this idea is clearly something that should be a Gitcoin grant. Not something that maker is funding. Let us know when that’s live so FBL can be the first DAI in. Also, FFS, read the Man who solved the markets to realize how much sentiment analysis works into the worlds largest hedge fund’s models. What’s most interesting about this SPF are:  We expect jumps to be at these hard coded values instead of variable values. ← fair, but not a hill to die on. We could probably broaden our horizon of data sources and be more proactive than reactive (ideally even automated). ← Trying to incorporate a predictive analysis score/alert makes sense but it shouldn’t be the whole pie.  Like, these are okay assumptions, but then this whole thing goes off the rails. The tactics alongside this proposal  might be the most openly hostile thing on this forum to date. Which is saying a lot. Governance Communications Core Unit (COM-001) Funding Request - December 12, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Send it, have conviction in this team executing more endgame native programs in the near term. Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit (SAS-001) Funding Request - December 12, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Roadmap adjustments! Excellent. Also an ability to run auctions natively on a desktop is probably really useful side effect for inexperienced keepers to enter the markets. Dai Foundation Board Member Election Poll - December 12, 2022 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Daimon-Law Reasoning: Daimon Law has produced excellent comments in the community. Conflict of interest in other ecosystems here seems overblown but worth keeping an eye on. 0xBocaJ is awesome but the work in the ecosystem is a little close to be simultaneously on the board of the DAI foundation. His work is better spent on things like the legal quagmires of MetaDAO’s because, well, his work is good and he’s a fantastic contributor. content.content: Supported today’s executive for SES and DUX; MKR vesting and delegate comp. Simple enough and nothing that wasn’t already expected.  Confirm Trial Deployment of DssKiln - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Burn 0.5 million DAI worth of MKR 2nd choice: Do not burn any MKR Reasoning: Would prefer seeing the Kiln in the wild and wish the testing amounts were smaller. Voting for a reasonable burn amount to get this out the door. Approve One-time MKR Distribution to Correct CES-001 Incentive Program Shortfall - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We can’t keep punishing people who stay. Especially when the consequences fall on them for lack of a leadership by a facilitator. Ratification Poll for Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics (MIP4c2-SP29) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve both 2nd choice: Approve only the Higher Participation Requirements and Weighting for Executive Votes Reasoning: Makes a lot of sense to increase delegate velocity, and definitely a no brainer incentivizing protection of the hat. Suprising to see FBL as the current abstain leader (). There is some worry about the complexity of endgame leading to making worse decisions by removing options. Likely the community will be able to pivot to solve any shortcomings of this MIP that we discover in production. Ratification Poll for Amend MIP51 to Remove MIP51c4 (Calendar Exceptions) (MIP4c2-SP28) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: Originally FBL was onboard with the vigilance of a community for a protocol that never stops. That being said, humans keep the contracts tended and if a threat arises pretty confident in Maker’s ability to rally through a crisis. Ratification Poll for MIP14 Repeal (MIP4c4-SP2) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: Due to endgame’s consistent changelog and a need to tighten up our resource allocation (people and projects), removing the ability to fund anything flexibly is problematic. Ratification Poll for Obsolete MIP Removal (MIP23, MIP28) (MIP4c4-SP3) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Yep. Pruning obselete MIPs is good. Ratification Poll for Remove MIP14c4 (Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling) (MIP4c2-SP32) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Due to endgame’s consistent changelog and a need to tighten up our resource allocation (people and projects), we’ll need more felxibkle funding parameters for work. Don’t love this but agree. Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for February 2023 (MIP14c2-SP1) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Ratification Poll for Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster (MIP55c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Ratification Poll for Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults (MIP13c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Abstain Ratification Poll for Defense Fund (MIP55c3-SP14) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes

content.content: Ratification Poll for Core Unit Offboarding (COM-001) (MIP39c3-SP7) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve Offboarding, 60,700 DAI Golden Parachute and 100% Multiplier for retroactive MKR - additional 107,317.50 DAI (CU-preferred) Reasoning: Always a shame to see contributors get ground up in DAO machinery. We’ve been there and empathize. Voting for the golden parachute and MKR. Hoping that a break and some time to recalibrate opens fresh opportunities for Gov comms contributors. Ratification Poll for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund IS-001 from Dec 2022 to May 2023 (MIP14c2-SP2) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Excited to see teams optimize for ecosystem actors. If these DLO initiatives pass before then should be enough tooling for funding hybrid teams like immunefi. Ratification Poll for Commercial Risk and Legal Domain Work to Support SF-001 Expanded Mandate Related to RWAs (MIP55c3-SP12) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Roo’s work so far has been illuminating and much-needed for the DAO. Support extending for legal oversight. Ratification Poll for Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster (MIP55c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: This needs more work before approval. Even with a work breakdown –and thanks for that !– the deliverables still break off into "we’ll figure it out as we go " territory. Ratification Poll for Onboard-Amend Keeper Network - Chainlink Automation (MIP63c4-SP5) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: More keepers are important and hopefully, we’ll have more than a handful as Maker expands over the year. Sam’s talk was also a good overview of why more keepers matter. Ratification Poll for Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults (MIP13c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Switching to yes, even through we helped author, because not only does the DAO need this, it’s better to have conviction for the MIPs you contribute too. Thanks to @rspa  for the push. Ratification Poll for Onboard PSM USDC to Yearn to earn Yield (MIP92) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Yearn inclusion of dropping fees, permissionless-ness, and willingness to work with maker is a win for both protocols. We like the blue pill. Ratification Poll for MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment (MIP4c2-SP31) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: This seems like clarity and improvements overall for keepers. Empowering the sequencer to keep networks honest and avoid spam attacks is a win. Decrease GUSD PSM Fee Out (tout) - January 16, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Decreasing the tout is easily fixable but helps relieve any outflow pressure, should they choose to. Adjust the GUSD PSM Debt Ceiling - January 16, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: No change (500 million DAI). 2nd choice: Decrease to 100 million DAI. Reasoning: Drama is always worrying in CT, but Gemini’s willingness to reach out to the maker community has set a high bar that is refreshing. Confident we can navigate this external mess to the benefit of the community. FBL volunteered to help steward a working group towards workable milestones setting parameters up for success. That being said, lowering to 100 MM is also acceptable.

content.content: Adjust the Debt Floor (dust) - January 23, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Option 1 - Broad Reduction 2nd choice: Option 2 - Limited Reduction Reasoning: Making UX for vault users better is usually great and dust is a significant feature. Limited reductions across the board seem like the pragmatic approach with gas spiking time to time. The sim is also really helpful though, the debt weighted CR on ETH-C balancing against total volume & liquidity was a concern. Generally at this point in time it seems logical to open the floor. content.content: Supported this weeks exec -liquidating old stablecoin vaults  fine tuning the CRVSTETH vault MOMC changes CU comp delegate comp  Short Ratification Poll for Phoenix Labs Initial Funding (MIP55c3-SP15) - March 6, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: After recent polling to allocate towards phoenix labs it seems reasonable to set aside small SPF to get the ball rolling. Slightly concerned about moving a little quickly on this, but not letting perfect be the enemy of the good. Decrease the RETH-A Dust Parameter - March 6, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: With the lowered fees a smaller dust makes sense to stimulate R-ETH demand. Still, supporting the exec for emergency parameter changes; hardening the protocol to weather a wild weekend of panic. Edit: plus one to this    Coldiron.eth Delegate Platform   We are not too excited about the GSM-Delay-change,

content.content: Supported the **out-of-sequence executive spell ** this morning so the DAO can mitigate issues that might hit, especially as the turbulence continues in the markets. But more broadly, this is a useful tool to have for CU’s or scopes to manage PSM’s going forward. If there is an opportunity to revise the speed on the MOM will be happy to contribute to defining that parameter control. content.content: Ratification Poll for Onboarding Retro as CES-001 Facilitator (MIP41c4-SP40) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Slightly worried about the workload, but @Retro  has done a good job with a wild amount of responsibility dropped on his plate. Ratification Poll for Phoenix Labs - Spark Lend Launch (SPF) (MIP55c3-SP16) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Spark lend is definitely a great chance for the DAO to experiment and its budget is quite modest for the scope. Ratification Poll for Expand Facilitator Definition to Allow Entities (MIP4c2-SP34) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: FBL is an entity hoping for growth, so we sympathize greatly with the need to support companies as facilitators. Ratification Poll for Risk Facilitator Onboarding (RISK-001) (MIP41c4-SP41) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Monet and Rema are top-tier; excited to have double facilitators on the risk team. Looks like they already earned their stripes with “wild weekend.” Ratification Poll for Protocol Engineering Facilitator Onboarding (MIP41c4-SP42) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: see above points about entities. Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for March 2023 (MIP14c2-SP5) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Yes to Funding techops. Hoping to see them find a sweet spot as Maker stumbles into a different structure. Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget (DECO-001) (MIP40c3-SP89) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: Thought this MIP was a place to refine and talk about next steps for DECO? as is, it’s just cutting budget without an offboarding MIP which is strange. Seems like a warning shot that didn’t get enough attention to be actionable or create meaningful momentum for change. Budget Ratification Poll for GovAlpha Core Unit DAI Budget 2023-2024 (MIP40c3-SP90) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve BasePlus budget - 904,805 DAI 2nd choice: Approve Base budget - 805,805 DAI Reasoning: In the current context Govalpha has been pushing above and beyond for the parallel world we live in. Budget Ratification Poll for GovAlpha Core Unit MKR Budget Q2 2023 (MIP40c3-SP91) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: They work too hard, definitely on board with MKR budget. Short Ratification Poll for Vault Setting Amendment Subproposal (MIP92c5-SP1) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Didn’t we like the Corn and the bunny? @Doo_StableLab did a great job proposing a vault that fit within conservative limits. Return Excess MIP65 Funds to Surplus Buffer - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Excited to see the first payments back to the DAO from Clydesdale. Increase the MIP65 (RWA007-A) Debt Ceiling - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: We do not share a combative stance or vitriol but Clydesdale clearly needs a slight restructuring based on community response & the confusion. Scopes or MIP, either way works. Ideally a scope so Clydesdale can be restructured into a win/win for everyone (better fee structure, clearer expectations). Also, some clearer guidelines on when there are problems and how to resolve them seem perfect for the framework’s first use case. This vote just seemed just a bit out of order: throwing out huge sums without aligning on fees sounds like we’ll be in the same debate in a month. Not gonna die on this hill, it’s fine that we get excess yield, but will advocate for fixing those changes when the opportunity arises. Remove the DC-IAM from MIP65 (RWA007-A) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: The risk calculus here seems off, not dying on this hill either.
